page.title: 15Park Hall Country Park cont
page.content: and include sparrowhawks,kestrels and owls.The pools attract not only the common water fowl such as mallard but also such rarities as the ruff and green shank.The pool areas are also abundant with frogs,newts and toads. Mammals are also found in the park such as stouts,shrews,weasels and most abundant hares. The park is looked after by Park Rangers.The job of the Ranger is not to act like a policeman but to be a security service.The Rangers often give talks and guided tours around the parkland.There are always at least two rangers on duty at Park Hall Country Park.At times the Rangers may be called upon for maintenance and helping to deal with dangers.The main duty of the rangers is to protect the wildlife from the people.
